body_html:
Hi, i had the same problem, and if you take a look about the configure script:

if [ -z "$CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH" ]; then
default_cuda_path=/usr/local/cuda
read -p "Please specify the location where CUDA $TF_CUDA_VERSION toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is $default_cuda_path]: " CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH

So you have nothingt to do, just find your nvidia toolkit, mine was located in:
/usr/lib32/nvidia-364

so just:

export CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH=/usr/lib32/nvidia-364

And you are done

body:
Hi, i had the same problem, and if you take a look about the configure script:

if [ -z "$CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH" ]; then
    default_cuda_path=/usr/local/cuda
    read -p "Please specify the location where CUDA $TF_CUDA_VERSION toolkit is installed. Refer to README.md for more details. [Default is $default_cuda_path]: " CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH

So you have nothingt to do, just find your nvidia toolkit, mine was located in:
/usr/lib32/nvidia-364

so just:

export CUDA_TOOLKIT_PATH=/usr/lib32/nvidia-364

And you are done
